pr_title: Implement OS and some process resource attributes.

timeline.message: Implement OS and some process resource attributes.

timeline.bodyText: Are these attributes defined by semantic convention? If yes, I think a link to it will be useful here.
timeline.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: It's in the class javadoc - but thanks to the reminder I found it was a dead link :)
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: Would contains make the code more robust? I am not familiar with all the cases so I might be wrong.
timeline.author: thisthat

replies.bodyText: I took the approach from commons Lang - I think it's been vetted much more than anything I could ever come up with ;)
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: I would avoid reporting the attribute if no process id was available.
timeline.author: thisthat

replies.bodyText: agreed. I'd rather have no value, rather than a -1
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText:
Oops forgot, thanks!
Unfortunately, don't think there's any way for me to write a unit test for it.
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: We should create an issue for this, so the TODO doesn't lie dead in the code.
timeline.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: could you add a little comment about what the structure of this name looks like, so the code doesn't just look like magic. Thanks!
timeline.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: interesting assumption. This is definitely the most common location for a java executable, but is it universal enough to be encoded here?
timeline.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: On Java 9 we can have a better path using ProcessHandle I want to implement that at some point. This seems common enough for the base case that I figured it's ok but let me know what you think (I think a lot of tools would break if java wasn't at this subdirectory of the java home).
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: Let's go with it for now. I'm sure a user on some obscure platform will let us know when it's wrong. :)
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: I wonder what this does on Android, for instance. I also hope no one is running this SDK on android, since we haven't been (and don't intend to be) optimizing for that runtime environment.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: Currently it's guaranteed to crash because java management isn't available anyways :) I added a note to the README and note to the issue that we can reflectionize this too to unbreak.
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: I'm nervous about blindly adding all the command lines arguments from a java process.This could end up being gigantic, and also leaking senstivie information that is being passed in via system properties. Are we sure this is a good idea?
timeline.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: I guess if this isn't something we're putting in by default in the SDK, it's probably fine. I think we should definitely have some warnings in the module README, or perhaps in the javadoc, or somewhere. :)
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText:
Checked the output and it seems to only have system properties / normal command line, and not classpath for example which would be huge.
I think this point applies to the semantic convention itself so we'll probably need to find some guidelines on how to deal with this attribute there.
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: oh good. I was worried about the classpath, which would be gigantic. The point still holds for system properties and security, and you're right about the conventions probably needing some clarification. I'm still ok with this for now, since it's an opt-in extension module.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.message: Merge branch 'resource-os-process' of github.com:anuraaga/opentelemetry-java into resource-os-process
